frame.name: Dimension
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns words that express an <fen>Object</fen>'s position on a scale, its <fen>Measurement</fen>, with respect to some attribute, its <fen>Dimension</fen>. <fen>Location</fen>, identifying the sub-region of the <fen>Object</fen> where the <fen>Dimension</fen> is measured, may also be expressed.
<ex><fex name="Object">The tower</fex> is <fex name="Measurement">10 feet</fex> <t>tall</t>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Object">The new vase</fex> is <fex name="Measurement">5 cm</fex> in <t>circumference</t> <fex name="Locus">at the top</fex>.</ex>
Adjectives in this frame <ment>must</ment> appear with a measurement expression like <ment>5 cm</ment>.
Note the tagging of <ment>six feet</ment> on the GF and PT layers in the following sentence.
<ex><fex name="Object">The woman</fex> was <fex name="Measurement">six feet</fex> <t>tall</t>.</ex>
The GF of <ment>six feet</ment> is Dep and the PT is NP.</def-root>

FE.name: Dimension
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Dimension</fen> which is measured. Most LUs in this frame incorporate the <fen>Dimension</fen>.
<ex>The new vase is 5 cm in <t>circumference</t> at the top.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Object
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Object</fen> identifies the item which is measured along one of its <fen>Dimension</fen>s. <ex><fex name="Object">The new vase</fex> is 5 cm in <t>circumference</t> at the top.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Measurement
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Measurement</fen> identifies the extent of the <fen>Object</fen> along the specified <fen>Dimension</fen>.
<ex>The new vase is <fex name="Measurement">5 cm</fex> in <t>circumference</t> at the top.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Locus
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Locus</fen> identifies the sub-region of the <fen>Object</fen> where the <fen>Dimension</fen> is measured. <ex>The new vase is 5 cm in <t>circumference</t> <fex name="Locus">at the top</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

lexUnit.name: tall.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: how far the distance is from the base of an object to its top-most point (used with a number)

lexUnit.name: high.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of a measurement) vertically upward from some baseline

lexUnit.name: wide.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of great or more than average width.

lexUnit.name: broad.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of a specified distance wide

lexUnit.name: thick.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the measure of the width of an object (used with a number)

lexUnit.name: deep.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: how far the distance is from the top of an object to its bottom surface (used with a number)

lexUnit.name: long.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: in length.

lexUnit.name: breadth.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the distance or measurement from side to side of something

lexUnit.name: depth.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the distance from the top or surface to the bottom of something or to a specified point within it

lexUnit.name: length.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the measurement or extent of something from end to end; the greater or greatest of two or more dimensions of a body.

lexUnit.name: width.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the measurement or extent of something from side to side; the lesser of two or the least of three dimensions of a body

lexUnit.name: height.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the measurement of someone or something from head to foot or from base to top.

lexUnit.name: weigh.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of an entity) have a weight of (a specific measure).

lexUnit.name: measure.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of an entity) have a size, width, length, etc. specified as (a particular quantity).

lexUnit.name: weight.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a body's relative mass or the quantity of matter contained by it, giving rise to a downward force; heaviness.

lexUnit.name: area.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the extent or measurement of a surface

lexUnit.name: circumference.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the enclosing boundary of a circle.

lexUnit.name: around.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: indicating that a measurement pertains to a circumference or perimeter.

lexUnit.name: grand.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: large, ambitious, or impressive in scope or scale.

lexUnit.name: work.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the exertion of force overcoming resistance or producing molecular change

lexUnit.name: across.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: indicating that a measurement of length from one side of an object to the other pertains to a horizontal dimension perpendicular to the longest axis.

lexUnit.name: level.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a (usually unspecified) height.
